item.title: The damaged pavement is a hazard to elderly residents, especially the elderly, including me., 29th March
item.description:
The damaged pavement is located outside the drive of number 12, GL51 0LX. It is now getting much worse due to cars and vans turning around outside the property.

item.title: Hayden Lane - Pothole repair contractor ran out of tarmac, 29th March
item.description:
A repair was started on a pothole on Hayden Lane, but the contractors appear to have run out of tarmac. There is just a small amount of tarmac on one side in the bottom of it. The pothole is still as wide and deep as it was. What3Words ///files.stay.rounds
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised up area on the pavement where i caught the tip of my shoe and then fell over landing on the pavement., 29th March
item.description:
I was walking from Prestbury to town on the right hand side. Having crossed over the road that leads to Pittville crescent/Windsor Street and walked for about 12 metres continuing on Prestbury road, I tripped and fell forward landing full on the pavement. I took a photo of what i thought could have caught the toe of my trainer. So I think this is the area. However as I looked there are many uneven paving slabs and uneven ground so I felt it was important to report as an elderly person falling could have taken on more injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Repeat request for broken tarmac levelling, 29th March
item.description:
Marked with white paint '20m' but job not completed. See photos. Location next to light No.22 along the only path on Up Hatherley Way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes and uneven road entrance of Birdlip road and near the entrance to reservoir. Have been fixed multiple times, but all it has done is create more dips and pot holes, 28th March
item.description:
See above. Multiple potholes along the Aggs hill from the bend to the entrance of Birdlip road. It was not repaired despite being reported. The multiple pot holes run from the new tarmac that was laid today to entrance to Birdlip Road. To avoid them you have to drive in the middle of the road. To avoid the potholes on the other side of the road you also have to drive in the middle of the road. I have had near miss accidents due to cars in opposite direction being in middle of the road. These potholes and very uneven road surface have been reported multiple times and been filled multiple times but the road sees lots of usage for people going to cleeve hill radio towers or cutting through to A40. Can we have a more robust fix please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
